story:
Our Story

What is The Answer-Killing Question Buys a Crisis? Barry Germansky's biting, humorous, and insightful satire on institutionalized education – an inquiry into the nature of this bureaucratic form of learning and how it forces students and teachers to maintain arbitrary standards of knowledge. The play chronicles the struggles of a courageous university student as he rebels against his school's corrupt totalitarian regime and its imposition of a single answer to all possible questions. It's Nineteen Eighty-Four  meets Dead Poet's Society.

Our performance schedule will be announced at a later time, but we are aiming for an Off-Broadway world premiere in late July to kick off a two-week Off-Broadway run.


Who We Are

Barry Germansky is a Canadian playwright and screenwriter whose previous play, Follow the Tracks We Forgot to Finish, opened Off-Broadway last December.

Tim Sika, our play's producer, is the President of the San Francisco Film Critics Circle.

Steven Carl McCasland, our play's director, is the founder of the Beautiful Soup Theater Collective (from which we will cast our actors).


What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise funds to cover the costs of producing this play, with the theater rental comprising 75% of our budget. In return, we will deliver a unique, one-of-a-kind production that will leave you thinking long after the curtain falls.


By contributing to this campaign, you will become a part of theatrical history: you will be able to say that you helped give this play its Off-Broadway world premiere! In addition, be sure to check out the perks on the right side of your screen. We've got lots of exciting offers to say "thanks" for your support.


The Impact

Our new play aims to challenge the Western tradition of standardizing knowledge through excessively rigid and self-important institutions. To do this, we are advocating a more open-minded institutional learning process that values individuals and their individual ideas on a case-by-case basis. We seek to remind our audience that it's the people who make the institution, not the other way around.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to donate, there are many other things you can do to help us:

  • Spread the word about our campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, and more
  • E-mail friends and family who can donate and encourage them to support our project
  • Buy tickets to the production when they are placed on sale


Playwright Barry Germansky discusses The Answer-Killing Question Buys a Crisis:




We're in the news! Click on this text to read our first BroadwayWorld.com article!


A big shout-out to those who have already donated to our Indiegogo campaign and a call for others to become a part of theatrical history:

story:
Inappropriate Theatre Company is pleased to announce its next project in collaboration with director Denise Yvette Serna of London's East 15 Acting School.

LA CHINGADA
La Chingada is a modern exploration of the legend of La Llorona; it investigates the power of oral tradition to obscure truths over time, and seeks to re-imagine and reclaim not only La Llorona's story, but her Voice. The ensemble will utilize a collection of found text, folktales, classical text, Chicano poetry, liturgical iconography, transcripts from contemporary cases of filicide, and dance. The resulting collaboration will be a multi-sensory theatrical experience in the heart of Chicago.


What We Need & What You Get

We are a talented, resourceful bunch.  This production is being mounted on a little bit of money and a lot of hard work.

But, we would like to take the show to it's full potential, and that requires us to put money into lights, sound, videography, costumes, and to the artists involved.

 In return for your support, we are pleased to offer some incentives to our backers. 

  • Pledge $5: An exclusive production photo signed by the cast, emailed to you.
  • Pledge $10: 'Loose Change' PLUS a personalized thank you video from the cast.
  • Pledge $20:  'Laundry' PLUS **SPECIAL**: In addition to all above, the first 20 people to pledge $20 will receive a limited edition La Chingada prayer candle to be used during the show. (You must pick up your candle at will-call.) 
  • Pledge $30: 'Last Sunday' PLUS a free download of an exclusive Inappropriate LP which will include some tracks from the show. You'll be jammin'!
  • Pledge $50: 'Little Caesar's' PLUS Your name incorporated into a piece of art to be unveiled on opening night! How Fancy!
  • Pledge $75: 'Schnapps' PLUS 1 Admission to La Chingada AND 2 signature La Chingada cocktails! Give us your keys, we're driving.
  • Pledge $250: 'Bottle Service'  PLUS a secret, interactive performance experience during the show. (Think PunchDrunk meets Medea.)
  • Pledge $500: 'Bottle Service' PLUS we will come to your house and cook an Authentic Mexican meal. Yes, we're serious. (Must be in the Chicago-land area)
  • Pledge $2,500: Uhhhh... Give us a call and we can work something out.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know how tough it is to decide where your money goes, especially when there isn't much of it to go around.  For those of you who want to support the project in other ways, please consider sharing this page, and following us on any of our social media pages.

story:
The live experience is like no other. Horror movies, while scary, keep the audience at a safe distance. LA PETITE MORGUE doesn’t want you to feel safe. With a live performance, you never know what can happen. The show is never the same twice.  All that's standing between you and the maniacs and monsters on stage is an invisible fourth wall - a fourth wall that can be broken at any time. You're not just watching horror. Horror is watching you back.

LA PETITE MORGUE takes play submissions from all over the country, and showcases some of the greatest and most frightening work in our monthly FRESH BLOOD series. 

THE BEST OF FRESH BLOOD will be a terrifying evening of five short horror plays - some of the greatest and scariest from the reading series - fully staged at Stage Left Studio in Manhattan. Five plays, fully produced - that means blood and gore, special effects, costumes and props to bring these horror plays to life.

But we need your help to make it happen.

Please, help us terrify you.

All donors receive:

  • Acknowledgement on our blog, Facebook, and Twitter
  • Our literally undying gratitude and admiration
  • The promise that we will not, under any circumstances, axe-murder you!

Your donation will go towards:

  • Renting performance and rehearsal space
  • Printing and copying scripts
  • Production royalties (plagiarists are scary - but not in a good way)
  • Costumes
  • Make-up and special effects
  • Sets and props
  • Making posters and other publicity materials 
  • Printing event programs
  • Nightmare fuel

We promise we won't spend your money on:

  • Alcohol
  • Our rent or other living expenses
  • Therapy
  • Legal fees incurred due to our sick sense of humor

If you don't have the money to become a donor, there are still plenty of ways that you can help this horror show get up and running!

Other Ways to Help Us:

  • Spread the word about us on Facebook or Twitter
  • Donate space, printing, paper, or props we need
  • Donate a prize or gift certificate that we can offer to donors
  • Volunteer your technical, design, or marketing skillz

If you're interested in volunteering, giving a gift in-kind, or just want to chat, drop us a line at lapetitemorgue@gmail.com.  And don't forget to check out our website at LaPetiteMorgue.org!

story:
A Wake for Lost Time 

For the past year, Elephants in the Room Creation Group, has been working together to create a theatrical experiment that challenges our perception of the norm. Now, the collective will showcase their work through a 24-hour performance experiment  that focuses on how time passes through bodies. It's a disquieting party, an ardent ritual and an ode to what’s happening and what’s to come. This interdisciplinary theatre collective combines performance art, poetry, classical and post-dramatic theatre to create a show where the typical patterns break, clocks are flung aside and time, steady and relentless, conquers and is conquered by the stage debut from the Elephants in the Room Creation Group.

Featuring: Kanika Ambrose, Donna Marie Baratta, Kathleen Goodleaf, Jenna Harris, Karen Hawes, Thomas McKechnie, Michael Reinhart, Tanya Rintoul and Moez Surani.

Discover More Here: http://www.passemuraille.on.ca/elephants-in-the-room-creation-group/


The Impact - Why We Need Your Help

We are a group of ten emerging artists, and as most, need to fundraise to produce a show with all the fixin's. This show in particular is somewhat costly. As we perform throughout the long hours, we will require sustenance. Help us stay awake with beets and babybell cheese!

Whether you are friend or family member who cannot come, perhaps you live across the seas and are only able to catch the live feed but would like to contribute or maybe you don't know us but think to yourself "A dollar for Karma!", we invite you to help us reach our goal! 

The Money raised will also go toward: 

  1. Our brave stage manager,  who will be managing the premier of our 24-hour piece from January 10th- January 11th. 
  2. Props and production materials
  3. Ourselves - So the collective has an option to grow/shape this piece for future performances. 


The Performance

Audiences are invited to join and engage with us on:

  • Friday, January 10th: 7:30pm-10:30pm ($10)
  • Saturday, January 11th: 11:30am-1:45pm (PWYC) 
  • Saturday, January 11th: 3:30pm-7:30pm ($10)

Featuring: Kanika Ambrose, Donna Marie Baratta, Kathleen Goodleaf, Jenna Harris, Karen Hawes, Thomas McKechnie, Michael Reinhart, Tanya Rintoul and Moez Surani.

Location: Theatre Passe Muraille Backspace - 16 Ryerson Avenue 


'A Wake for Lost Time' will include a live stream of the entire 24-Hour performance. The streaming will begin on January 10th at 7:30pm. 
Please click the link below for more information and to watch the performance: 
http://www.ustream.tv/channel/a-wake-for-lost-time-a-performance-experiment-by-elephants-in-the-room

story:
THE PAST IS CALLING

A new musical with songs by Buck Evans and  book by Dennis Nyback  

In 1994 I wrote the musical review “Can't We Be Friends.” It was performed for two weeks in Seattle. It featured the stories , and the music, of women who wrote popular songs in the Twenties and Thirties. Continuing on that theme in 1998, living in New York, I worked on the American Masters documentary Yours for a Song: The Women of Tin Pan Alley. It aired nationally on PBS in 1999.

Then I began working on The Past is Calling. It was a more ambitious undertaking than anything I'd done before. Just as I was inspired by songwriters Kay Swift, Dana Suesse, and Vee Lawnhurst to produce Can't We Be Friends; the songwriter Buck Evans inspired me to write The Past is Calling.  I met Buck in college. He moved to Alaska. I moved to New York. I listened to his songs on homemade cassette tapes he'd send me. The story of the Past is Calling came to me as I listened to the the songs.

The play takes place largely in 1926; right in the middle of the Jazz Age. A problem with setting a musical play at that era is it is very hard for modern songwriters to write period music without it sounding forced at best or phony at worst. Buck has worked for years to capture the natural style of Tin Pan Alley composers. It is his genius that makes this play possible. How ambitious is it? The Past is Calling features an original story. It is much more common for musicals to be made by adding songs to a previous work. A musical that grows from songs is a rare thing.

The world premiere of The Past is Calling will be in January 24-26 in Portland as part of the ten day long Fertile Ground Festival of new works. If it is done right it will later be mounted for longer runs at larger venues. Just as Can't We Be Friends in Seattle resulted in a nationally aired PBS documentary; my hope is The Past is Calling will eventually make it to Broadway. For that to happen the performances in January have to be as good as they can possibly be.

It takes more than a village

Here is where you come in. It costs money to mount a play. It costs more to mount a musical. I paid for Ten Cents a Dance out of my own pocket. I was able to do that because it was a one performance show featuring vintage songs that were available in printed sheet music. Also because it was a radio play there was no expense for costumes or the set. It was a benefit for KBOO radio with no venue cost.  I was also helped by many volunteers.  That production cost me around five hundred bucks.   This one will cost about twenty times that.  Specifically; paying the musicians will cost $2,700. Paying for the space is $650. The set will cost $3,000 at a minimum (which includes the cost of bringing in a vintage upright piano).  Lighting will cost $1,000. For costumes, microphones, paying the cast, and all incidentals I hope to keep it under $3.000. The costs pencil out to ten thousand dollars. That is the goal. Buck's songs, and the greatness of the jazz music of the Twenties, demand the best musicians possible. It also demands musicians who can act and actors who can sing and dance. Oh, Ideally I would like to pay for Buck to come down from Alaska to take the role of the piano player.  It is nice that indiegogo is different than Kickstarter. If the goal is not met I will still receive all that you pitch in. I promise to make the very best of it.  

Other ways you can help

I have lived my life by valuing my time more than money. Pitching in cash is not the only way you can be involved and helpful.  Let your friends know about the campaign. Check out the share Indiegogo share tools.  I will also need help in Portland with costumes, set construction, lighting, and other things.  Putting on a play is fun!

Thank You

I think the world would be a better place with more music in it. I grew up with LPs of South Pacific, Oklahoma, Camelot, and others in the house. Today I looked at twenty pages of current indiegogo campaigns. This is the only new musical. With your help it will be heard, and heard, and heard, and heard and someday there will be people singing the songs on the street.

story:
Short Summary

We've commissioned 6 playwrights to write new short plays based on the works of Edgar Degas.  These 6 new plays are being presented at The Den Theatre (1333 N Milwaukee Ave, Chicago, IL) in a festival called "Master Works: The Degas Plays" on May 29 - June 1, 2014.

Playwrights: Matt Beard, Rachel Bykowski, Jackie Davies, Spenser Davis, Cassandra Rose, Julia Weiss

Directors: Wm. Bullion, Jonathan Goldthwaite, Tiffany Keane, Kacie Smith, Abby Stark, Ginny Trover

Famous for capturing female dancers and playing with unusual angles, Edgar Degas influenced several major modern artists, including Picasso.  Now, Commedia Beauregard calls upon the Parisian painter to inspire six new plays which translate his works to the stage.

Six award-winning playwrights and six amazing local directors compete for the awards of "Best Translation" and "Audience Favorite"

See the paintings here!

The Cast: Ashley Boots, Kayla Boye, Natalee Cooney, Linsey Falls, Kanome' Jones, Chris Lysy, Amber Robinson, Brendan T. Stallings, Steven Stinson, Shawna Tucker, Leigh Yenrick, Phil Zimmermann

The Company

Commedia Beauregard is a small professional theatre company in Chicago, Illinois.

We have been around since 1999 (starting in Minneapolis/Saint Paul) and have put up 30 productions over the last 14 years.  Since 2011 we have been HQ'd in Chicago.

Here's our mission statement:
"Our mission is to translate the universal human experience to the stage: to expand our horizons and share knowledge of all cultures, translating between languages and between arts to create theater that is beautiful in expression."

What does that mean?  Well, normally we do plays that are translated from foreign languages into English.  Sometimes we experiment with what it means to translate, and we end up with a play based on a painting, or a ballet based on an essay.  

The Impact

This project involves 24 Chicago-based artists in total: 6 Playwrights, 6 Directors, 12 Actors

By supporting this project you bring their work to 70 people per night in live performance.  You also make it possible for us to publish the script in book form so the plays can be read and enjoyed for years to come.  And a published script may even lead to other theatre companies doing the show elsewhere someday!

theatre company in Chicago, Illinois.We have been around since 1999 (starting in
Minneapolis/Saint Paul) and have put up 30 productions over the last 14
years.  Since 2011 we have been HQ'd in Chicago.
Here's our mission statement:
"Our mission is to translate the universal
human experience to the stage: to expand our horizons and share knowledge of
all cultures, translating between languages and between arts to create theater
that is beautiful in expression."
What does that mean?  Well, normally we do
plays that are translated from foreign languages into English.  Sometimes
we experiment with what it means to translate, and we end up with a play based
on a painting, or a ballet based on an essay.  The ImpactThis project involves 24 Chicago-based artists in total: 6 Playwrights, 6 Directors, 12 ActorsBy supporting this project you bring their work to 70 people per night in live performance.  You also make it possible for us to publish the script in book form so the plays can be read and enjoyed for years to come.  And a published script may even lead to other theatre companies doing the show elsewhere someday!

story:
Hello, my name is Jocelyn Clark and I am currently a Sophomore Dance Major at The Boston Conservatory in Boston, MA . My mom first enrolled me into dance at age seven as just being another activity for me to try as a kid. But little did she know that my one experience on the stage could change my life forever. Here I am now, nineteen years old still striving to pursue my love and passion as a dancer. I'm striving to become successful in this career, but in a smart and beneficial way. Growing up in a Christian based home, I've always had the heart to give back to my community. With feeding the homeless on thanksgiving, going to nursing homes to sing carols, and dancing at nursing homes, my heart is filled with joy. Knowing that at the end of the day I was able to bring a smile on their faces and warmth in there  heart. To me that's what this entrainment business is all about, giving back and encouraging the youth to follow their dreams. I have a strong desire to continue pursuing my career , But as you know dance is a very expensive business to be in, but the rewards are far much greater than any price tag. 

 My mom has been supporting my dreams of becoming a successful dancer for a very long time although she wants to she can't afford to fund school, housing and summer programs, they say that it takes a village to raise a child well i'm asking for support from the village. I've recently been accepted into the Lines Ballet Summer Intensive in San Francisco, CA, where I plan on furthering my education and increasing my technique. As a dancer it takes more than the learning from your studios or colleges, you have to branch out and get as much training as you can from everywhere. It creates a well rounded dancer which is key to booking jobs after college. I want to become the best well rounded dancer I possibly can and by attending Lines Summer Intensive, it'll help me reach that goal. With you're generous contributions you can help me improve in my career and become the best performer I know that I can be.  Thanks you all so very much in advance.

Sinceraly 

Jocelyn Clark

story:
Hello!

We are a group in Rhode Island from Brown, URI, JWU, and the community (already graduated) who are putting on a FREE production of A Very Potter Musical. AVPM, as we like to call it, is a full length musical parody of the Harry Potter series, originally written and performed by Starkid years ago. Due to parody laws, copyright laws, and other such legalities, we are NOT allowed to pay our actors/stage crew/musicians or charge admission. Because of this, we have no budget for our show. However, we are allowed to accept donations as long as every cent is spent on the show and it's materials, not the people (such as gas money, compensation for sewing, etc.).

This is why we ask for your help! We promise to use your donations solely for the show; NOT for our personal use. We are extremely passionate about this and will put on this show no matter what, but with your donations, we will be able to pay for:
- A nicer, larger theater to fit the crowd we know will show up (AVPM has a big following)
- Materials for our costumes and our set that our two set designers will be using to do a lot of sewing, building, and painting - so they don't have to buy the materials themselves
- Printing scripts for every actor (most of us have a limited amount of money to spend on printing per semester)
- A better, more accurate set
- Printing programs for our show dates
- All in all, putting on the best show we can!

If we do not reach our goal, whatever money is sent to us will be prioritized as best as possible. We will greatly appreciate any donation. This show means a lot to us; we are big fans of the original, big fans of Harry Potter, and BIG fans of theatre!

What you will get if you donate (a thank you letter will be sent with every donation):
$5 - A digital cast photo emailed to you.

$10 - A 4x6 cast photo mailed to you.

$15 - A 4x6 cast photo and a photo CD with photos from the shows.

$20 - A 5x7 cast photo, a photo CD, and an audio CD.

$30 - A 5x7 cast photo, a photo CD, an audio CD, and up to five 4x6 printed photos of your choice from the shows.

$40 - An 8x10 cast photo, a photo CD, an audio CD, and up to five 4x6 printed photos of your choice from the shows.

$50 - An 8x10 cast photo (signed or not), a photo CD, an audio CD, your choice of EITHER up to ten 4x6 printed photos from the shows OR a DVD of the show, and a guaranteed seat at your choice of any of our shows!

$60 - An 8x10 cast photo (signed or not), a photo CD, an audio CD, up to five 4x6 printed photos from the shows, a DVD of the show, and one guaranteed seat at your choice of any of our shows.

$80 - An 11x14 cast photo poster (signed or not), a photo CD, an audio CD, up to five 4x6 printed photos from the shows, a DVD of the show, and one guaranteed seat at your choice of any of our shows.

$100 - Your choice of:
1.) An 11x14 cast photo poster (signed or not), a photo CD, an audio CD, up to ten 4x6 printed photos from the shows, a DVD of the show, a guaranteed seat at your choice of any of our shows, and a personalized thank you video from the cast.
2.) A 12x18 cast photo poster (signed or not), a photo CD, an audio CD, your choice of EITHER up to ten 4x6 printed photos from the shows OR a DVD of the show, a guaranteed seat at your choice of any of our shows, and a personalized thank you video from the cast.
3.) A 5x7 cast photo table top canvas print, a photo CD, an audio CD, a DVD of the show, a guaranteed seat at your choice of any of our shows, and a personalized thank you video from the cast.

$150 - A 16x20 cast photo poster (signed or not), a 5x7 cast photo, a photo CD, an audio CD, up to ten 4x6 printed photos from the shows, a DVD of the show, one guaranteed seat at your choice of any of our shows, a signed program, and a personalized thank you video from the cast.

$200 - Your choice of:
1.) A 20x30 cast photo poster (signed or not signed), a 5x7 cast photo, a photo CD, an audio CD, up to twenty 4x6 printed photos from the shows, a DVD of the show, 2 guaranteed seats at your choice of any of our shows, and a personalized thank you video from the cast.
2.) An 8x10 cast photo table top canvas (signed or not signed), a 5x7 cast photo, a photo CD, an audio CD, up to twenty 4x6 printed photos from the shows, a DVD of the show, 2 guaranteed seats at your choice of any of our shows, and a personalized thank you video from the cast.

$300 - Any of the above with ten 5x7 photos instead of twenty 4x6, a guaranteed seat at any of our shows, a signed program, and signed copy of your favorite Harry Potter book (just bring it to the show).

* If you wish to be anonymous, you could email me (Amanda) directly and we can work together on how to send you your gifts.
* If you wish to just donate and not receive any gifts, please make sure to let me know in an email or at checkout (if there is a box for notes).

Even if you do not contribute money, we ask that you please share this campaign on any and every social network you are a part of. Thank you for taking the time to read this and we hope you have a "totally awesome" day!

Sincerely,
The Cast

story:
A Very Basic Synopsis

Tallulah Bankhead finds herself seated at a bar in what appears to be a formerly elegant old city hotel, now somewhat run to seed. Young and handsome Charles the bartender is there with her, supplying her every wish in the way of alcoholic refreshments.  They are soon joined by Cole Porter, Bea Lillie and Noël Coward, and then Ethel Merman comes wandering in, followed by Judy Garland.  None of them have the faintest idea of where they are or how they got there.  Tallulah leads the barbs, innuendos and repartee -- the others, not to be outdone, rise to the occasion -- then the fun (and the story) begins!

Heavenly Evening

The musical comedy Heavenly Evening began several years ago as a musical revue with  dialogue. Gradually, the story expanded, and I wrote more songs for the show. Then, John Nasca, entranced by the quality of the songs, entered into the project, and here we are, with a masterfully written script and 22-plus great original tunes. Now, the show is ready to go.

I'm asking you to please be an important part of this thrilling theatrical event which will open in October of 2015, the very height of Chicago's theatrical season.

Chicago director/playwright John Nasca has written a brilliant script filled with laughs and poignancy. You'll have an inside look at the delicious, scandalous lives of Judy Garland, Ethel Merman, Beatrice Lillie, Cole Porter, Noël Coward and the incomparable Tallulah Bankhead. The script is fine tuned and ready for the director and actors to work their magic.

My excitement and pride over the quality of the script and music is boundless.  After being successfully tested in numerous readings, Heavenly Evening has become a hilarious, glamorous evening of outstanding theater!

I've written the music and lyrics, with additional lyrics by our dear friend and associate the late Nina B. Feinberg and also by my old songwriting partner James McCall Cramer.

We hope you will help us to mount a production which can build upon itself, and become a self-sustaining theatrical run in Chicago. We need 100 thousand dollars to pay the production expenses for a minimum 6 week run, with 4-5 performances per week, employing a cast of seven singing actors.

A small but mighty orchestra of seven players (piano, bass, drums, trumpet, alto sax/reeds, tenor sax/reeds and violin) all professional musicians, will be necessary. The orchestra arrangements are finished and ready to go.

Why This Show?

Heavenly Evening is more than a brilliantly crafted and entertaining evening of fun and music.

Over the years, I've spent a lot of time delving into the lives of all of the stars who comprise the characters of the show, and I have a deep love and reverence for them.  John Nasca is a walking encyclopedia on these famous personages. This show needs to be produced, and become a success, so that many more persons of all ages can become familiar with these show business legends, who gave us so much in so many ways.  The world needs this entertaining and uplifting original new musical comedy.  You can help us achieve this end - we need your support to make this a first class production.

Our Fundraising Goal of $100K

Of course this type of theatrical event is costly. Theater rental itself will be around $18,000.00. Union cast and musicians will be the next costly expense, along with advertising, set and costume design, plus the many other items that make for a successful production.

It will take every bit of $100K or more to produce this show. However, if we fall short of our goal, we will do a non-union production. Whatever the case, this musical will be produced in October of 2015.  In Chicago, we need to make the theater rental arrangements more than one year in advance, which is why we're starting our fundraising campaign now.

The Perks

I have structured the perks we're offering so that you'll be given recognition for the amount you donate. We believe that this musical is going to become a classic, and we will everlastingly appreciate every donation, from the smallest to the largest. Your listing as a supporter of Heavenly Evening will continue in the show program for as long as the show runs, plus you will be listed in any subsequent runs in other cities, should the show become a financial success.

Your Contribution

Your contribution will be appreciated and treasured, and I, the cast and director will be forever grateful that you decided to become such an important part of this new work.  Two months before the musical goes into rehearsals (June/July 2015) we'll contact you with the October/November performance schedule.  You will then be able to pick the dates of performances you'd like to attend and/or would like tickets for, as a redemption of the perks you'll be receiving through your donation.  The CDs will be mailed out in October 2015, or earlier. We're realistically looking at rehearsals beginning in August 2015, and performances beginning in October 2015.

If you're unable to help in the form of a donation, please help by spreading the word about Heavenly Evening -- your friends might never forgive you for missing out! And don't forget the Indiegogo share tools.

Remember to take a look at the additional YouTube videos (the round links directly below) of more music from Heavenly Evening.

Thank you - Thank you - Thank you!

Sincerely,

Robert Benson

story:
My name is Remy Connor and I love magic! I have been performing for the past 13 years around the country, learning and developing a show that truly reflects what goes on in my head. This is my number one passion in life, I have given up nearly everything to be able to pursue this as my full time career, including having a home. For 2 and a half years, I was a homeless magician performing for tips, food and shelter. 

These talents were discovered by Team USA, and they asked me to join and perform at the World Championships of Performing Arts. Just to be asked to be a part of this is a huge accomplishment, but I don't want to stop there.

Once I get to the World Championships of Performing Arts, there will be casting, talent, and booking agents at the event that will help jump start my career by putting my name and talent in front of the people that would be hiring magicians.

It is quite an expensive trip though. The entry fee is $1595, which covers you for the classes, seminars, meet and greets and the contest entry. For me to travel to Los Angeles with my show will cost $1000. The hotel room will be $1600 for the ten days. Luckily, I know how to eat on a budget. The remainder of the budget will go to polishing off the last parts of the show.

Thank you for helping with this monumental opportunity.

story:
Project Summary

  • The Queens Players are the pre-eminent classical theatre company in Queens LIC. Resident Artists at The Secret Theatre, The QP have been in existence since 2005. We strive to produce the best quality theatre and to be true to the incredible talents of Shakespeare, Marlowe, Moliere, The Greeks and our other iconic playwrights. So far we have produced so many shows its hard to count but including The Tempest, Romeo and Juliet, As You Like It, and Cyrano De Bergerac.
  • We are very passionate about our ideas for this show but need your help. It's virtually impossible to do a show with the scale and depth that we have planned without funds. Your contribution will help us build authentic punk influenced sets, great costumes, music and more. We are intending to make a unique playbill in the style of a punk fanzine and therefore even photocopying for the show can be a significant cost, running to many hundreds of $.
  • Our vision is far-reaching and it's exciting to know that with your help we will be able to put our actors in unique costumes produced by Fashion Designer and Project Runway finalist, Sue Waller, with a playbill that has unique contributions from the punk originals like UK writer musician Mark Perry [Sniffin Glue/ATV], Lindsay Hutton [Next Big Thing/Cramps], illustrator Savage Pencil [Sounds/The Fall]. Our music supervisor is Anthony Rizzo [Maron/IFC/Radio4]. Our graphic designer, Bulgarian artist Luba Lukova, is designing all of our playbills this season.
  • Thank you and please help us spread the word!
story_txt:
Project Summary
The Queens Players are the pre-eminent classical theatre company in Queens LIC. Resident Artists at The Secret Theatre, The QP have been in existence since 2005. We strive to produce the best quality theatre and to be true to the incredible talents of Shakespeare, Marlowe, Moliere, The Greeks and our other iconic playwrights. So far we have produced so many shows its hard to count but including The Tempest, Romeo and Juliet, As You Like It, and Cyrano De Bergerac.

We are very passionate about our ideas for this show but need your help. It's virtually impossible to do a show with the scale and depth that we have planned without funds. Your contribution will help us build authentic punk influenced sets, great costumes, music and more. We are intending to make a unique playbill in the style of a punk fanzine and therefore even photocopying for the show can be a significant cost, running to many hundreds of $.

Our vision is far-reaching and it's exciting to know that with your help we will be able to put our actors in unique costumes produced by Fashion Designer and Project Runway finalist, Sue Waller, with a playbill that has unique contributions from the punk originals like UK writer musician Mark Perry [Sniffin Glue/ATV], Lindsay Hutton [Next Big Thing/Cramps], illustrator Savage Pencil [Sounds/The Fall]. Our music supervisor is Anthony Rizzo [Maron/IFC/Radio4]. Our graphic designer, Bulgarian artist Luba Lukova, is designing all of our playbills this season.

Thank you and please help us spread the word!

story:
The story begins…

The story begins when one woman crossed the Wyoming border on a cross country bike trip. At that moment her long held dream of beginning a theatre for women and girls became crystallized.  When she returned to Tampa, Powerstories Theatre was born and the first show “Let the Stories Move You” performed in 2000 to sold out audiences!

The rising action…

Working out of “whatever” space they could find to rehearse and do workshops, Powerstories provided at least 20,000 individuals the opportunity to perform in an original story concert, learn how to seek and speak true stories, or attended one of the many original productions. In the past 12 months alone, over 1400 youth attended free shows performed by middle school girls, and 240 young girls received theatre and leadership workshops.

The leading question of the story…

Where do you your thing? It became clear after 12 years that Powerstories needed to find a home! So, volunteers and staff began the search and an amazing space was found to put down roots.  A 1,000 square foot facility with high ceilings in a GREAT and very visible location on a bus route was found.

This is it. The big chance. The step up. We have always dreamed of operating out of a space that will allow rehearsals, workshops and … and…this is the BIG DREAM…the opportunity to do our OWN season of shows!  We'll also be able to offer performing and rehearsal space to other theater groups in the Tampa Bay area.

It’s amazing…and thrilling…and we need your help to make our dreams a reality.

Our next important chapter…

Our goal is to create an intimate performance space (30 seats max). This performance space will be quickly convertible from the more usual rehearsal/class room space of the facility taking little time, labor and storage space.

To that end, we have designed a system of walk along traveler curtain track that allows curtains and masking to be stored in a completely out of the way position along the walls of the room.  Theatrical lighting that can be kept in place and is simple to use for instructors and students alike. A uniform theatrical vinyl surface that will serve both as an appropriate floor for classes and performance.  Comfortable and lightweight folding chairs and easily movable seating risers complete the convertible facility.

The conversion into a performance space should take two people as little as 30 minutes.

The vast majority of the materials and equipment required for this project are easily installed and when the time comes for the organization to move to larger quarters much of the investment can be recouped and easily moved to a larger space.

BUDGET

It is estimated that the entire budget for the conversion will be less than $15,000.00.  With the addition of professional design and consulting fees and a suitable contingency the total budget should be under $19,000.00

SEATING - $2100

We have specified the KI/DuraMesh folding chair.  These chairs are a durable professional black, meeting all interior standards (California Fire Standards), featuring a breathable mesh seat and poly back. A lightweight tubular steel frame allows for easy set-up and take-down while providing safe and sturdy support. DuraMesh chairs are easy to fold, rearrange and transport. They lock together in rows as code requires and for a lightweight folding chair are remarkably comfortable.

SEATING RISERS - $1000

We have specified custom risers that fit the exact needs of the space. Two 3’x 8’ risers with an elevation of 6” and two 3’x8’ risers with an elevation of 1’.  These will have fire rated indoor/outdoor carpet tops to cut down on foot and chair noise; built in hand grips for ease of movement and will be finished inside and out with fire retardant paint.

FLOORING - $1750

We have specified TIMESTEP flooring for the performance area. TIMESTEP is a heavy duty multi-purpose flooring, ideally suited for all movement activities including ballet, tap, theatrical, jazz, modern, ballroom, and character. This flooring handles heavy scenery and props. As TIMESTEP is an industry standard, additional flooring may be acquired.

LIGHTING SYSTEM - $2600

New LED lighting technology allows a relatively low cost/ highly versatile design for this multipurpose space. Eight wash units each with 151 highly efficient LED’s allow for different lighting "looks", only consumes 20W and  have an approx. 50,000 hour bulb life. Three spot units with 61 LED’s each will provide versatility and lighting “specials”, only consumes 8W. Lighting is remotely controlled through industry standard protocol DMX 512 allowing for control of intensity/color via a remote controller

The controller specified is CHAUVET  Stage Designer 50. This controller takes the size of a 24-channel dimming console and the functionality of a 48- channel console combining them into one powerful dimming unit. Stage Designer™ 50 has up to 8 pages with 12 scenes each and 96,000 programmable steps. The console allows user to re-assign channels as needed, will be suitable for use with additional LED fixtures.

CURTAIN SYSTEM - $6100(entire package)

An elaborate but simple curtain system designed for quick and easy conversion into a theatrical space has been accomplished with a system of walk along traveler tracks that divide up the room storing flat against walls. The design allows for “light proof” entrances for audience and performers. Curtains will be opaque 22 oz Encore velour (Inherently Fire Retardant) sewn with 100W% fullness.  Walk along track is industry standard track from ADC.

Powerstories Theatre is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization, so the portion of your donation that doesn't pay for a perk is tax deductible.

story:
What Our Project Is About

This funding project is setup to help The Carbon Schuylkill Community Theater (CSCT) to meet our goal of raising money in order to rent an Audrey II (large venus fly trap type of plant) for our production of Little Shop of Horrors.  We are a very small and new community theatre and therefore we do not have a large amount of funding.  This is our first time doing a mainstreamed or named production here at CSCT.  So, we really need to be able to raise these funds in order to make it a successful event.  This show is the spring board which we hope to use to propell CSCT into the world of great community theatres.  We want to be able to expand ourselves in both quality and technical delivery of the shows we perform.  This $500.00 would help to make Little Shop a large success, and if we can raise this we hope that this show can help us to put The Carbon Schuylkill Community Theater on the map and establish ourselves a name in the area.

What We Need & What You Get

This 500 dollars will be going primarily towards the puppet which costs a little over 300 to rent.  The rest of the money will be put towards the set pieces that we still need to construct, costuming that needs to be finished, and props which will beed to be purchased.  

If you help us to fund raise we have 6 different levels of support that you could choose from.   Any one of them would be greatly appreciated.  We cannot offer huge perks as we are so small, but we are offering some pretty unique and exciting perks for what we can afford to give away.  

If we do not reach our full 500 dollar goal we will put whatever money we get toward the rental of the Audrey II puppets. 

The Impact

This project is the turning point and is important to us in producing the musical.   With out your support we won't have the full funds to make this show work.  A lot of other theatres on here are looking for a few thousand to fund whole seasons, but we just simply need this money to get through the end of this season and through this show.  

As previously stated, this show can really be a spring board for CSCT into the Carbon and Schuylkill counties of Pennsylvania as well as other surounding counties.  We feel this is vitally important because there is not a lot of quality theatre in our area for people to be able to view.  If we would become a bigger theatre we believe that theatre can make a come back in the Carbon and schuylkill counties.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot afford even 5 dollars we could use your help to simply spread the word about our campaign.  We are only asking for $500.00 total, but more would be amazingly gracious.  As much money as we can raise can help us in a great way so even if you can't contribute please spread the word to other theatre lovers who you know.  Also, come out and support the show August 3rd at 7pm and August 4th at 2 PM at the Lehighton Borough Annex Auditorium, 110 N 3rd Street Lehighton, PA .

Thank you all so much for your help!

Zane Bachert(Director), Jonathan Rodgers(President of the Board), Jake Tokosh(Seymour), and Marissa Miller(Audrey/Treasurer)

story:
Short Summary

 

REBECCA'S HISTORY: Choreographer, dancer, actor, and instructor, Rebecca has traveled throughout Canada, the United States, Europe, and Australia to strengthen her choreography skills and further her experience within the industry. Training within ADAPT Syllabus for dance, as well with a professional performance company 'The Young Canadians of the Calgary Stampede' for over 12 years, Rebecca comes from a very technical background. In dance, her main focus is on contemporary and hip-hop, but she enrolls herself in many other styles including breaking, popping, ballet, tap, acro, plus. 
Rebecca has showcased her choreography in music videos for artists such as Lights “Timing is Everything”, Classified and MUGZ. Her strong and diversified technical background allows Rebecca to work within many fields in the industry. Rebecca has coached children in performance and acting for the Stampede Talent Competition, and has now moved on to adjudicating dance competitions, including Kiwanis Dance Festival. Teaching since 2004, Rebecca has won choreography awards in competitions around the country. Her energy does not go unnoticed, and she puts everything into each experience. Rebecca Reinhart has also since branched out into other areas of the performance industry. Through her involvement as Assistant Director and Assistant Producer for KOKUS Productions, Rebecca has choreographed for, and performed in, shows such as ‘The Bazaar’, ‘Talent Defined’, ‘Toronto's Fringe Festival', plus. 

 

This video is mainly about agape love - covenant love of god for humans, as well as the human reciprocal love for god. The term extends to the love of ones fellow man. ("You would die for them"). The other types of love included are Philia - friendship or brotherhood, & Eros - sexual nature.  Mixing nature, dancing, and sexuality, the dance is meant to show intensity - different moments in love - the ups the downs, the growth. Scenes will be interconnected to each other (showing that the type of love can change in any moment and grow together to form the highest strength in their lives together)


LOCATIONS: Cottage Country and a Studio 

 

I have been creating and building this idea for over a year - with many attempts that just didn't stick. I am ready for this one to stick and for me to build the appropriate cast and crew. With inspiration from music videos, live shows, dancers, movement, and the music, I would like to create my own 'dance music video' to share and touch masses of people on the beautiful subject love through dance and movement. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

I am attempting to raise around $1000 for this project. Dancers usually work for free - and we (dancers & choreographers) have been attempting to create jobs and situations where all cast and crew can get paid. Coming from simply a moment of inspiration, I will need some help raising the cash for the weekend away filming. 

The set is at a cottage in 'cottage country'. I will be needing to rent a vehicle for the crew ranging from $225-$599.97. Supply food and snacks for a crew of 5-8 people ranging from $300-$500. I have a camera already but will need to rent lighting for around $1000 itself. 

I just want to show the love!!!!! I think we all need to realize the different types of love that can keep frienships, families, and lovers together. Love can cause so many emotions (great and unnerving), and I just believe we should all focus on the amazing emotions and feelings.

The funds, whether fully rasied or not, will go towards all expenses necassary to make this project come to life. Any amount of money will help these not so full artist pockets of mine (One day when my pockets are more full, I will be searching and donating to eager artists like myself).

The Impact

Dance is a form of art that can, with the use of music, inspire any individual. As artists we are here to make people feel. Feel greatness, feel the 'pain of life' as some of us say. Life is so much more than just a simple day to day experience -there are people, situations and emotions that fill the moments in our lives with beauty. I want to showcase a love that has inspired me to be a better person. I believe in spreading love to everyone and every situation, in any type of love (agape, philia, or eros). 

I want to simply make people feel. Feel, remember, and emote the expereinces they have, or have had, with someone special (whether it be a friend, spouse or family member). 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you believe in love and this project, feel free to pass this info along to someone who may be interested in helping. I am all about great people and support! I can't wait to be in the position to help a fellow artist out with their dreams. Step by step 'ooh baby' we can do this!

 

Share and donate! And once the video is up, enjoy and feel free to show those around you who may feel inspired.

story:
My name is Kazuki Takase. I am an actor/director living in NY.

My brother is a kabuki actor who lives in Osaka, Japan and he is visiting NY for the first time in 10 years. I mentioned his visit to my friends in NY and they all said that they want to see his performance, especially his dance.

We came to a conclusion that we can produce his dance concert.

However, it costs a lot of money: theater rental, costume and wig, technicians at the theater, etc.

Although we contributed money, we still need several thousand dollars.  Even if we go without elaborate costumes and wigs it is going to cost another $5,800 for the venue, insurance and tech labor.

We would appreciate your contribution to make this rare opportunity come true. If you can't donate please spread the word about this project.

story:
Our Mission:

The Spindle City Players is a small theatrical group located in Cohoes, NY. We were created to ensure students, of the Capital District of New York, access to a free quality theater arts education program. This program is not only to teach students how to perform on stage and recite lines. Our students leave knowing how to write an original show, design and create a costume, build a prop, design a set and the many other technical aspects of theater. This group will also be giving back to their community through various community service outside of the productions. Our group is also here to support each other. If someone is having a bad day we are all available to help talk it out. We believe it takes a village to raise a child, but that a child may also raise a village. Please support us in our dream to make the Spindle City Players' experience the best that it can be.

Who we are:

Marisa Ledesma-Henry and Ryan McCormick founded the Spindle City Players originally called the Cohoes Youth Performing Arts Foundation in August of 2012 after major funding cuts were made to the performing arts budgets of schools in the Capital District.

Marisa Ledesma-Henry, a graduate of Cohoes High School (1999) and an alumnae of Wagner College’s musical theater performance program, has worked in the theater industry for over 30 years with the New York State Theater Institute, Capital Repertory Theater, Park Playhouse, Highlight Acting Troupe, STAR, the Whole Village Theater and Young Actors Guild.

Ryan McCormick is a junior at Cohoes High School and has been a part of productions with the Cohoes City School District, Highlight Acting Troupe, Young Actors Guild, Troy Actors Guild and C-R Kids. Ryan decided to expand his theater range and learn about all the workings behind the scenes. Prior to Spindle City Players, Ryan has been working as the lighting designer at the Cohoes High School, an Assistant Stage Manager for the past four years with C-R Productions at the Cohoes Music Hall, and most recently held the position of Stage Manager for the Cohoes Music Hall's C-R Kid's productions of 15 Reasons NOT To Be In A Play and Disney’s Sleeping Beauty.

The Nannylogues:

The groups premiere production, The Nannylogues, was written and created for our group by Marisa Ledesma-Henry. Marisa created the basic theme and character outlines, which the cast then further developed into a series of transitional monologues. Because the actors had a role in developing their own characters, those characters became more personal allowing them to more deeply embrace the true essence of each character. Throughout the pre-performance production the actors' creative writing skills excelled.  The production development and rehearsals lasted for three months culminating in a two night run. The dinner theater production opened on February 1, 2013 with a second performance on February 2nd, at Shawn P’s Restaurant at the Van Schaick Country Club and was a major success!

Murder on the Green:

Murder on the Green is a murder mystery that revolves around the mysterious death of The Van Schaick Island Country Club’s President, Dick Van Schaick. The mayhem and confusion among the many suspects and the conflicts in their alibis lead the audience on an interactive chase as they get be deputy detectives to the performance's own Detective Max Remsen. Who at the Country Club wanted Van Schaick dead? It could be the down-to-earth gardener, Jane Wison, who cares more about her plants than people, or the too often criticized Top Chef, Roberta Clemmons. Maybe the award winning swimmer, Trixie Lane, or the ex-pro golf player, Chip Spaulding did the deed. Perhaps the murder was committed by the trophy wife, Vivian, the high school sweetheart ex, Tiffany Paris or the club treasurer's daughter, Penelope Handle. The audience will get to ask questions of all the personalities, and in the end guide Det. Remsen toward the culprit. The show is expected to open in mid November at the Van Schaick Country Club. This production will be a dinner theater, but this time the audience is a large part of the show. It's a killer!

Our Goal:

We must raise $1500 to continue our program for all of our students. We do NOT charge  our students a fee to be a part of our productions but instead depend upon fundraisers, ticket sales, underwriters and donations from the general public to carry on this amazing program.

When we reach our goal of the whole $1500, we can move forward in the process of becoming an official non-profit educational based organization. We will be a real business where young actors and production crew learn about and hone their theater skills. All donations over the goal will be used fully toward future productions.

 PLEASE SEE THE FILE FOR THE  COMPLETE BUDGET BREAKDOWN IN THE GALLERY

Your Impact

By helping us raise our goal of $1500.00 you help Capital District young adults become well rounded actors and production crew. Some of these teens would never get an opportunity to perform in quality theatrical productions because of financial limitations, non-access to professional coaching and creative development or lack of craft study available in their community.  For those who performed in The Nannylogues, there has been a dramatic difference in the presentation of their craft and individual confidence.  Our students are more confident and well groomed then when they started. By contributing to our cause, you will help to keep this quality theater program growing.

 

Other ways you can contribute:

Please share our information! The power of social media and word of mouth can overcome any obstacles. Come and, in this case, participate in our show!  We encourage you to use the Indiegogo sharetool to tell your friends about us and how they, too, can sponsor our organization!

Thank you for supporting the arts!

This program is not only to teach students how to perform on stage and recite lines. Our students leave knowing how to write an original show, design and create a costume, build a prop, design a set and the many other technical aspects of theater. This group will also be giving back to their community through various community service outside of the productions. Our group is also here to support each other. If someone is having a bad day we are all available to help talk it out. We believe it takes a village to raise a child, but that a child may also raise a village. Please support us in our dream to make the Spindle City Players' experience the best that it can be.
Who we are: 
Marisa Ledesma-Henry and Ryan McCormick founded the Spindle City Players originally called the Cohoes Youth Performing Arts Foundation in August of 2012 after major funding cuts were made to the performing arts budgets of schools in the Capital District. 
Marisa Ledesma-Henry, a graduate of Cohoes High School (1999) and an alumnae of Wagner College’s musical theater performance program, has worked in the theater industry for over 30 years with the New York State Theater Institute, Capital Repertory Theater, Park Playhouse, Highlight Acting Troupe, STAR, the Whole Village Theater and Young Actors Guild. 
Ryan McCormick is a junior at Cohoes High School and has been a part of productions with the Cohoes City School District, Highlight Acting Troupe, Young Actors Guild, Troy Actors Guild and C-R Kids. Ryan decided to expand his theater range and learn about all the workings behind the scenes. Prior to Spindle City Players, Ryan has been working as the lighting designer at the Cohoes High School, an Assistant Stage Manager for the past four years with C-R Productions at the Cohoes Music Hall, and most recently held the position of Stage Manager for the Cohoes Music Hall's C-R Kid's productions of 15 Reasons NOT To Be In A Play and Disney’s Sleeping Beauty. 
The Nannylogues:

The groups premiere production, The Nannylogues, was written and created for our group by Marisa Ledesma-Henry. Marisa created the basic theme and character outlines, which the cast then further developed into a series of transitional monologues. Because the actors had a role in developing their own characters, those characters became more personal allowing them to more deeply embrace the true essence of each character. Throughout the pre-performance production the actors' creative writing skills excelled.  The production development and rehearsals lasted for three months culminating in a two night run. The dinner theater production opened on February 1, 2013 with a second performance on February 2nd, at Shawn P’s Restaurant at the Van Schaick Country Club and was a major success!
Murder on the Green:
Murder on the Green is a murder mystery that revolves around the mysterious death of The Van Schaick Island Country Club’s President, Dick Van Schaick. The mayhem and confusion among the many suspects and the conflicts in their alibis lead the audience on an interactive chase as they get be deputy detectives to the performance's own Detective Max Remsen. Who at the Country Club wanted Van Schaick dead? It could be the down-to-earth gardener, Jane Wison, who cares more about her plants than people, or the too often criticized Top Chef, Roberta Clemmons. Maybe the award winning swimmer, Trixie Lane, or the ex-pro golf player, Chip Spaulding did the deed. Perhaps the murder was committed by the trophy wife, Vivian, the high school sweetheart ex, Tiffany Paris or the club treasurer's daughter, Penelope Handle. The audience will get to ask questions of all the personalities, and in the end guide Det. Remsen toward the culprit. The show is expected to open in mid November at the Van Schaick Country Club. This production will be a dinner theater, but this time the audience is a large part of the show. It's a killer! 
Our Goal:
We must raise $1500 to continue our program for all of our students. We do NOT charge  our students a fee to be a part of our productions but instead depend upon fundraisers, ticket sales, underwriters and donations from the general public to carry on this amazing program.
When we reach our goal of the whole $1500, we can move forward in the process of becoming an official non-profit educational based organization. We will be a real business where young actors and production crew learn about and hone their theater skills. All donations over the goal will be used fully toward future productions.
 PLEASE SEE THE FILE FOR THE  COMPLETE BUDGET BREAKDOWN IN THE GALLERY

Your Impact
By helping us raise our goal of $1500.00 you help Capital District young adults become well rounded actors and production crew. Some of these teens would never get an opportunity to perform in quality theatrical productions because of financial limitations, non-access to professional coaching and creative development or lack of craft study available in their community.  For those who performed in The Nannylogues, there has been a dramatic difference in the presentation of their craft and individual confidence.  Our students are more confident and well groomed then when they started. By contributing to our cause, you will help to keep this quality theater program growing.
 
Other ways you can contribute:
Please share our information! The power of social media and word of mouth can overcome any obstacles. Come and, in this case, participate in our show!  We encourage you to use the Indiegogo sharetool to tell your friends about us and how they, too, can sponsor our organization!
Thank you for supporting the arts!

story:
About Us

See the lady with the Statue of Liberty hat, that's me. My name is Amada Anderson and I am the director of a non-profit organization called Thrill The World NYC.

This organization was founded in 2009 after I was invited to create an event in my city. I was originally looking for something fun to do while losing weight and I came across YouTube videos and DVD's teaching the "Thriller" dance as part of a global event called Thrill The World. It's an annual worldwide event where people come together to dance simultaneously in tribute to Michael Jackson for world records and for charity.

After registering New York, I followed the advice of the Thrill The World website and reached out to see if anyone was interested. I was surprised by the amount of Michael Jackson fans who wanted to partake in this adventure. After he died on June 25th, what started as a fun Halloween community event quickly turned into a legacy. 

Since 2009, we have successfully raised awareness and support for various charitable organizations such as VH1 Save The Music, UNICEF, Boomer Esiason Foundation, Eve Ensler's V-Day Campaign and One Billion Rising, and our favorite charity The Pajama Program where we collect new pajamas and new children's books for kids in need. We have performed all over New York City being featured in movies, parades (We led the 7th Annual Dance Parade this year), and contributed classes to various schools and community centers.

And now every year, we have participants who join us all over the world to participate in our New York City event. Over 500 people registered in 2009 and the list just keeps on getting bigger which means we need a bigger venue and better equipment, all of which costs money. So we really need your support to help us reach our goals!

How much do we need?

We need close to about $1500.00 to support our October 2013 goals. Not only are we performing at our event on October 26th but we are also participating in the 40th Annual Halloween Parade. The approximate breakdown of the costs are as follows:

  • Insurance certificates ($300+)
  • Permits (park $25 + $45 sound permit)
  • Speaker System (being donated by DJ Kasper, but we would like to give him a tip for his time) ($100)
  • Generator Equipment ($120+ including gas for both 10/26 & 10/31)
  • Truck Rental ($200+ including gas to and from city for both 10/26 & 10/31)
  • Toll Fees ($60 to and from the city for both 10/26 & 10/31)
  • Dance rehearsal space $400 for all classes ($20 an hour x 2 hours x 100)
  • Water Bottles for our dancers ($40 for both events)
  • Table and chair rentals ($150+)

If we raise over budget, this will definitely help because any funds our campaign receives will be charged 6.75% by Indiegogo. We can use left-over funds to go towards next year's events.

Please share a copy of our press release that can be found here:

http://thrilltheworldnyc.com/ttwnyc2013pressrelease.pdf

What do you get in exchange for helping us?

  • $5.00 Get a personal SHOUT-OUT on Facebook, Twitter and our Webpage, sure to be seen all over the world! (Includes amazing gratitude and recognition.)
  • $10.00 Get an Official TTW Photograph taken & a Zombie-Hug on Thrill Day (October 26th) by a Thrill The World NYC Zombie Dance Crew Member! (Includes everything at the $5 level)
  • $20.00 One 2-hour THRILLER CLASS! Have you ever wanted to learn Michael Jackson's Thriller dance? Learn the moves and then join us for world records and for charity! Our annual event is on October 26th from 2pm-6pm at East River Park Bandshell, Manhattan, New York. Learn The dance. Change the world. (Unlimited amount / includes everything at the $10 level)
  • $25.00  Autographed copy of "Borough Of The Dead" by Andrea Janes, a creepy collection of frighteningly true tales of New York. (Only 1 available / includes everything at $20 level)
  • $50.00 Halloween Parade Dance Package - Includes two 2-hour dance classes where you will learn dance moves from Michael Jackson's "The Drill", "Beat It", and "Thriller" and get to join one of the most amazing parades in the world, The 40th Annual Greenwich Village Halloween Parade! Be a ZOMBIE ROCKSTAR and DANCE the night away with DJ Kasper and the Thrill The World NYC team! (Unlimited amount / includes everything at $20 level) 
  • $75.00 Haunted Broadway Tour! (Good for 2 Tickets) Do you find yourself humming creepy tunes like the theme from The Addams Family *snap snap* or find yourself randomly doing the Time Warp again? Then this is the tour for you! Join us as we explore the spookier side of Broadway. Visit legendary haunted theatres and locales where those denizens of the dark dwell and famous Vaudeville/Broadway stars still take to the stage long after the curtains have closed and after the ghost lights have been turned on. Sing along to famous dark musicals like Jekyll and Hyde, Sweeney Todd, Evil Dead:the musical, Carrie:the musical (which was so scary it only had 5 performances!), Ghost: the musical, Little Shop of Horrors, Phantom Of The Opera and more. THIS IS A MUST FOR MUSICAL THEATRE FANS. (Unlimited amount / includes everything at $50 level) 
  • $75.00 SCARE YOURSELF INTO SHAPE WITH BOOT CAMP PILATES! (30 Mins) - A fusion of Power Mat Pilates + Strength Training Exercises. New York City Personal Trainer KMJ Fitness. (Only 1 available / includes everything at $50 level) 
  • $75.00 SCARE YOURSELF INTO SHAPE WITH A CARDIO DANCE/SCULPT CLASS (30 Mins) - A fusion of High Impact Aerobic Workouts choreographed to the latest Dance/Hip-Hop Music; mixed w/body sculpting exercises. New York City Personal Trainer KMJ Fitness. (Only 1 available / includes everything at $50 level) 
  • $75.00  SCARE YOURSELF INTO SHAPE WITH DIANNA, a member of our MJ FAM/TTWNYC dance crew who is ready to work out/rock with you! Spend 45 mins with her at one of the hottest gyms in New York: Equinox! Voted Best Gym in America by Fitness Magazine. (Only 1 available / includes everything at $50 level)
  • $100.00 Ever walk the streets of New York and get the weirdest feeling that ... you're being watched??? Well, you just might be!!! GHOSTS OF NEW YORK is the oldest ghost walking tour company in the city and they are offering 4 tickets to go exploring with a personal tour guide. See New York's paranormal phenomena, occult manifestations, and ghostly happenings. Don't you DARE miss out!!! (Only 1 gift certificate good for 4 people / includes everything at $50 level)
  • $100.00 Mother of all Zombies, Gypsy Amada, reads Palm, Energy, or Tarot for all your spiritual wonder! Join her for a 30-45 minute session and take back control of your destiny! (Only 5 available / includes everything at $50 level)
  • $150.00 Are you stuck? Do you feel like you could use some life coaching advice? Get ready to take charge of your life and play powerfully! Meet Dre, “The Butterfly Queen” and CEO of The Power Players Club. (Only 1 available / includes everything at $50 level)
  • $200.00 Thrill-A-Gram! Dancing zombies will come to your office, home or private residence and perform THRILLER in a personalized monstrosity! (Manhattan based locations only please). (Only 5 available / includes everything at $50 level)
  • $500.00 Associate Producer. 

    Donations in the amount of $500 include a Thrill-A-Gram, Tarot/Energy/Reading by Gypsy Amada, Personal ghost walking tour or Haunted Broadway tour of their choice. (Includes everything at $50 level)

  • $1000.00 Producer. Donations in the amount of $1000 include lunch with Amada Anderson the event organizer of Thrill The World NYC (where you can pick her brain) & a banner with your name or company printed and placed onstage on Thrill Day as well as on our truck during the Halloween Parade. This banner will be seen by thousands of people. (Includes everything at $500 level)

Thrill The World NYC's Impact

This organization is not just about the dance or about Michael Jackson. This is about building a community of amazing artists and volunteers who every year come together to show support to their local communities. 

Thrill The World NYC isn't just an annual event, we have grown to sharing our love of dance all year round.

We have partnered with numerous companies, radio stations, and corporate events to continue to raise awareness as well as volunteered our time to read with the Pajama Program kids and teach the Thriller dance for Wellness Week at various schools. We want to be able to continue this work and appreciate any assistance you can give. 

WHY DONATE TO TTWNYC?:

  • Michael Jackson’s Thriller is a iconic. It is loved the world over. It is the greatest selling record of all time.
  • Dancing is healthy and a fun way to keep fit. No treadmills, no weights… Just music and movement. If you have never danced before, think of this as an exciting personal challenge. If you have always wanted to learn the Thriller routine, think of this as a dream come true.
  • As a world record philanthropist and ceaseless humanitarian, Michael gave over $300,000,000 to charity. You can continue these honorable actions.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to give money, how about volunteering your time to helping us build this event by donating your services or spreading the word about this event to your friends? We do offer an internship; for every 2 hours you volunteer, you can receive a 2-hour class. Contact Amada Anderson, Event Organizer and Co-Chair of Thrill The World at thrilltheworldnyc@gmail.com for more info.

Please help share the L.O.V.E. Thank YOU!

Visit our website for more details: http://thrilltheworldnyc.com

Direct Donations:

Thrill The World NYC is a fiscally sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, a non-profit arts service organization. Contributions for the purposes of Thrill The World NYC must be made payable to Fractured Atlas and are tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law.

TTW NYC’s mission strives to encourage service-giving through the art of music and dance. We look forward to using these universal commonalities to encourage individuals of all ages to engage in creative service projects.

You can also make a donation in an amount of your choice on using the Paypal button above or through visiting our Fractured Atlas page. 

Our Sponsors and Friends:

Please meet our sponsors and friends:
Abracadabra, Boroughs of the dead, Boomer Esiason Foundation, Broadway Dance Center, City of New York Parks & Recreation, Coney Island Dancers, Cultured Movement, NYC Dance Parade, Dance Manhattan, DJKasper, DJDeeJay, Fractured Atlas, Gadget Trish, Ghosts of NY, Halloween Adventure, Halloween Parties.com, Itsi Atkins Productions, Kits and expendables, KMJFitness, Legacy of Love, Luna Park Horror Night, Manada.Biz, Mean Fiddler, Michael Jackson Fans of NYC, MJJSociety, Moses Harper, New York Broadway Tours, Powerfully Positive Power Players Club, Ray’s Pizza, Rocky Horror Picture Show NYC, Sylvia’s Restaurant, Think Big Promos, ThrillerNYC, Transformational Body Painting, UNICEF, Wicked Willies, ZombieCon, ZombieCrawl

story:
Student written, performed, directed, and produced, the Gravitas Theater Festival looks to be a two night, six performance explosion of ability across multiple disciplines at Bard College. With artistic contributions expected from students in the theater, music, written arts, film, and studio arts divisions, the festival promises to display the merits and artistic prowess of a prominent liberal arts institution. Beyond the ever present desire for more theater at Bard, the festival was created to increase opportunity for production of student-written work before senior project, and to promote collaboration amongst the Bard arts departments before, as one curator dubbed, "the mass exodus from Annandale to New York City." With that in mind, a contribution is not only an investment in fantastic art but also in the fantastic art of the future.

We're raising money for costumes, props, and sets. The theater, though paying little, costs a lot. In order to fund six individual original one acts, looking outside of the funds the college can provide is our only option. Considering the ambition of the project, we think it's worth it. Extraordinary shows will enliven the Bard student arts scene and inspire the creation of work for following festivals and beyond. Contributors receive perks straight from us, from a name in the inaugural playbill to a signed and bound copy of the accepted play to a videotape of both night's performances. If we do not reach our fundraising goal, the collected funds will still be used for the festival.

As curators, as Bard students, and as artists ourselves, we would like to thank you for considering support for the arts. We are confident that we speak for everyone participating in the festival that your donations make what we desperately want to do possible. We hope to see you in late November! *Exit perused by a bear excited about Gravitas.*
